occupation: International Trade Capability Consultant and Analyst at Georgia-Pacific LLC
headline: International Trade and Compliance Analyst at Georgia-Pacific LLC
summary: I am currently heavily involved international trade and consulting. With previous experiences as a system process engineer, and a strategic sourcing analyst. I have adept skills in business intelligence, process design and optimization, coding in multiple languages, financial engineering and legal research and negotiations. Alongside, I have a fluent understanding of international trade industry and the necessary inputs to optimize business integration into foreign markets based on policy and customs. I am currently seeking to experience professional environments where I can apply my skill set to help support teams in a consulting position, specifically focusing from a quantitative perspective. While working in the professional environment I plan on pursuing my Ph.D. regarding research in economics examining the quantitative affect of social and economic policies within people of color from low socioeconomic backgrounds. My experiences are structured to prepare myself to open a charter school system and many future influential ventures in society. I am an eager and hardworking individual who is up for any challenge placed in front of me.

experiences.title: International Trade Capability Consultant and Analyst
experiences.description: Oversees projects to automate USMCA certifications and improve quality of Artificial intelligence reviews of international exports for packaging and cellulose divisions. Developing and enhancing current tools for different business segments to strategically understand and efficiently recognize foreign market opportunities, while consulting business segments on international trade compliance standards. In addition, focuses on automating transaction testing processes with vetted statistics to better support international trade compliance group and their 4 major business segments.

experiences.title: International Trade Capability Consultant and Analyst
experiences.description: Oversees projects to automate USMCA certifications and improve quality of Artificial intelligence reviews of international exports for packaging and cellulose divisions. Developing and enhancing current tools for different business segments to strategically understand and efficiently recognize foreign market opportunities, while consulting business segments on international trade compliance standards. In addition, focuses on automating transaction testing processes with vetted statistics to better support international trade compliance group and their business segments.

experiences.title: Student Event Planner and Assistant
experiences.description: Currently I serve as a professional representative of the Gaines Oldham Black Culture Center at the University Missouri-Columbia. My role consists of devising, planning, and executing different events in a lead role for the center. Coupled with writing grants to acquire new assets and projects for the center to encompass. As well as, serving as a representative at professional events as a representative of the center. Finally serving as a desk attendant providing exemplary customer service to current and prospective students visiting and residing within the Gaines Oldham Black Culture Center.

experiences.title: International Trade and Consulting Analyst
experiences.description: Oversaw and managed multiple projects as well as numerous day to day tasks. Specifically focused on creating a tool for different business segments to strategically understand and efficiently recognize a foreign market opportunity. Also, I developed automated systems to help with service tickets as well as to resolve transaction holds at customs between analysts, freight forwarders and business leads which saved 1.5 million dollars in late penalties.

experiences.company: McNair Scholars Program at University of Missouri-Columbia
experiences.title: Research Assistant
experiences.description: I currently looking into the area of education policies and how the affect students of color's productivity and success.Currently focusing on a project diving into what signify a minority serving institution and the affect this had in the institution's enrollment and ability to serve all sure l students.

experiences.title: Strategic Sourcing Analyst
experiences.description: Supported multiple divisions in their sourcing and procurement department analyzing different opportunities to renegotiate labor rates, devise visualizations through Qlik to make better to drive better purchasing behaviors, operated in pricing analytics, and numerous other areas to innovate and automate processes within Georgia Pacific's strategic sourcing and procurement.

experiences.title: Mentorship Chair of Executive Board
experiences.description: Worked as the Mentorship chair of the Executive Board to kindle better relations within NSBE chapter at the University of Missouri-Columbia, as well as in the local community.

experiences.title: System Process Engineering  Intern
experiences.description: During my time working as a system process engineer I worked on a multitude of projects varying from system streamlining to supply and demand planning. I also worked with developing my financial engineering skillset creating a forecasting tool to save over 5 million dollars yearly.
